column4: Does anyone how to start a program on a specific screen using Xinerama for Nvidia 6200 GPU using binary drivers on Ubuntu 8.04? | I only want to start VLC in that mode when a DVD-video is inserted. VLC opens standard when DVD is inserted but on wrong screen.
Devilspie doesn't seem to provide enough control for this situation
i alwyas use 'twinview' with the nvidia drivers and disable xinearams
I want to have apps in fullscreen, restricted to that screen and not pasted over my two monitors, that's why I use Xinerama with seperate X-screens (not displays)

err...  thats the reason i do not use xinerama -  But i use twinview to set up one very wide display  with 2 monitors. i do not use 2 seperate X sessions.  From what i recall twinview does everything xinerama does.. and more.
but perhaps more clarification on how you have thign setup is needed.
for example . I have a 'wide' desktop across 2 monitors. and i have mythtv set where it shows up on monitor #1 fullscreen.
ok what do you need?  do you want my Xconfig-file in the pastebin to peruse?
if you want to use 2 seperate indipendant X displays where you cant drag a window from one monitor to another. You would have to run the apps and set the display variable befor you run the app.
I can drag my screens from one to the other without problems

you mean windows? In that case you  should be able to just disable xinerama and enable twinview and keep doing the same thing. Full screen apps will then fullscreen to the monitor they are on. (or so its been in my experience)
true, but I want to start VLC when DVD is inserted on a fixed screen automatically.
check the command line options for vlc would be a good place to start also.
every time ive ever used xinerama and 'fullscreened' things - they took over both screens. So good luck
thanks for the hint, but there doesn't seem to be cmd-line option for that, I already checked ;-)
may be some extra vlc config /setting also. I tend to use gmplayer. So you are on your own.
I might be tempted to use that same player if I can get it working, I'm not tied to any player :-D
